reviews.text: Lovely station 😊 Ladies toilets clean, cubicles spacious and a brilliant hand dryer. Carol the toilet attendant was friendly and doing a great job! 😃👍
Beautiful train station with good services to London, Cambridge, Peterbrough and Birmingham

It was discusting to see how a worker in platform 1, a female worker, had shouted at a customer who only wanted to ask if this is his train. Yet she shouts to him to wait and then sends away the train that he wanted to ask about. No welcoming, no smiling, no helping. Poor bloke looked scared and confused...
If I would know this ponytail short woman's name, I would complain. If people don't want to work with people, they should be finding something more suitable for them. 
I thought station workers are here to help when we customers get confused with all the trains and stations.

The service pattern here leaves alot to be desired to be honest. The station at the very least has decent facilities such as toilets, a car park, ticket office and step free access to all platforms via a ramped subway. Please take care when walking down the subway, especially during adverse weather.

The staff on the station platform appear friendly and very helpful when approached, hence why I feel they deserve some stars,  However these dedictated and professional staff are being let down by those in the ticket hall.  When renewing my ticket today I was met with a young woman who clearly didn’t want to be on duty at 6:30 in the morning.  No greeting, no cheerful demeanour, and frankly no manners.  Her only priority was to chat to her colleagues.

Please not Ely ticket office staff: providing good customer service is part of your role.  Be cheerful and pleasant, and above all give undivided customer attention.  If you need any guidance on how it should be done, visit the ticket hall in Norwich station.
